title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: All Hingham/Hull ferry services on Feb. 13 are canceled due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace ferry service, running from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal starting at 6:30 a.m.
Recent snowstorm caused significant ice buildup, leading to more ferry cancellations than recent winters.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
Kennedy, 60, was hit on Wilder Street and later died at Lahey Hospital nearly a week after the incident.
The Massachusetts State Police are investigating the crash alongside the Middlesex District Attorney’s Office.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start 2026 in Triple-A Worcester due to health concerns and competition for first base.
Kristian Campbell is likely to begin 2026 in Worcester, despite an eight-year contract and past Rookie of the Month honors.
Prospects Payton Tolle and Connelly Early might not make Opening Day roster due to Red Sox's deep pitching options.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The ACLU of New Hampshire released documents showing state officials knew about the new ICE facility as early as Jan. 12.
Merrimack town officials were unaware of ICE facility plans prior to The Washington Post report in December 2025.
The proposed ICE facility in Merrimack, NH, is expected to be fully operational by the end of Fiscal Year 2026.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel confirms Will Campbell will remain at left tackle despite last season's struggles and injury.
Former coach Dante Scarnecchia supports keeping Campbell at left tackle, citing his potential and previous strong performances.
Ex-Pro Bowl tackle Terron Armstead offers to train Campbell, addressing technical issues to improve his performance next season.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel consoled Patriots players after their 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks at Levi's Stadium.
Vrabel emphasized unity and future potential, reminding players they have 'a lot more football left in our program'.
Despite the loss, the Patriots' 14-win season marked a significant turnaround from 2024, with Vrabel as head coach.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots move defensive coordinator Terrell Williams to a 'high-ranking' role on Mike Vrabel's staff.
Zak Kuhr, Patriots inside linebacker coach, favored to become full-time defensive coordinator for 2026.
Terrell Williams is now cancer-free, contributing to Super Bowl LX without health distractions.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield after being dragged by a vehicle.
Police found Colbert's body on West Housatonic Street near a Best Western Hotel.
Authorities are searching for the driver of a dark-colored sedan involved in the incident.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots lost Super Bowl LX to the Seahawks, 29-13, despite quarterback Drake Maye's record passing in one quarter.
Ann Michael Maye, Drake Maye's wife, shared gratitude and encouragement on Instagram, highlighting the team's progress and spirit.
Drake Maye plans to spend the offseason with Ann Michael, who gained popularity for her 'Bakemas' videos during the season.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Nick Gallagher, 38, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Boston Children's Hospital's Miles for Miracles team.
Gallagher's participation honors the care his family received after his son was born with a medical condition.
The Boston Children's Hospital's neurology team has supported Gallagher's family, enabling his son's successful treatment.
